result.execSummary:
The defendant Marlaina Scarlett Foster was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes:
If revoked, defendant may have release for work if employed at the time of revocation. 

If revoked, defendant may participate in vocational training or educational programming and may attend the Day Reporting Center.

miscConds.notes: Pay restitution in the amount of $946.73 to be paid to Nordstrom Rack. Restitution to be paid FIRST before all costs, fees and surcharges. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Maintain current employment unless enrolled full time in educational or vocational programming.
No contact with any Nordstrom store.

timeConds.notes: Court ordered 45 days of condition time in the House of Correction imposed but STAYED to be used at the discretion of the agent.

records.addlTxt:
Plea hearing proceeded. State placed negotiations on the record. Victim Impact Statement with attached restitution worksheet received and filed. 
Defendant sworn in.

As to COUNT 1 as AMENDED-
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.

Defendant Marlaina Scarlett Foster in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea and sentencing hearing. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. State filed an Amended Information. Defendant charged as follows:

COUNT 1- Misdemeanor Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (NOT > $500) - PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, contrary to sec. 943.50(1m)(b) and (4)(a), 939.51(3)(a), 939.05 Wis. Stats., a Class A Misdemeanor.

Defendant Marlaina Scarlett Foster in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  
James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations. 
Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter; plea date selected.  Parties advised effective August 3, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25, Room G55A of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marlaina Scarlett Foster in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties request another scheduling date.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Marlaina Scarlett Foster in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Catelin Ringersma for James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for 06-01-2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Marlaina Scarlett Foster
Current: 4135 West Eggert Place, Milwaukee, WI 53209   (Effective: 05-21-2015)
Prior: 4135 West Eggert Place, Milwaukee, WI 53209
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Nordstrom Rack and Mayfair Collection at 11500 W. Burleigh, Wauwatosa

Defendant Marlaina Scarlett Foster in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.vb

Defendant Marlaina Scarlett Foster in court.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
She was here and informed the court that her child was having hernia surgery this afternoon and could not make it to court. I rescheduled her court appearance for 5-21-2015, at 1:30 pm. If she fails to appear a WARRANT will be issued for her arrest.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 5/20/15 @ 1:30 pm
